subject: Re: [Read_Alphabet] Keyboard Layouts
msgSnippet: ... I m a keyboard maintainer too, but there really is no alternative to supporting both US and UK keyboard layouts. Blurb:  The Moby/Whacking family of Latin
messageBody:
mailinglists@... [Read_Alphabet] scripsit:

> Thing is, I don't want to maintain umpteen semi-QWERTY layouts —
> one should be enough.

I'm a keyboard maintainer too, but there really is no alternative to
supporting both US and UK keyboard layouts.

Blurb: The Moby/Whacking family of Latin keyboards for Windows
supports almost 1000 different characters on the US and UK physical
keyboards without preempting any key except AltGr (the right Alt key).
Moby Latin is for US keyboards; Whacking Latin is for UK keyboards.
There are four variants of Whacking Latin, namely Whacking John for
English, Whacking Sandy for English and Scottish Gaelic, Whacking Taffy
for English and Welsh, and Whacking Mick for English and Irish. You can
download them from <http://www.ccil.org/~cowan/MobyLatinKeyboard.zip>
and <http://www.ccil.org/~cowan/WhackingLatinKeyboard.zip>. The keyboards
are open source and source code is provided.

--
John Cowan http://www.ccil.org/~cowan cowan@...
Police in many lands are now complaining that local arrestees are insisting
on having their Miranda rights read to them, just like perps in American TV
cop shows. When it's explained to them that they are in a different country,
where those rights do not exist, they become outraged. --Neal Stephenson
